name: Central Arizona Shelter Services (CASS)
description: Emergency shelter, case management, and supportive services for individuals experiencing homelessness
contactInfo: 230 S. 12th Ave., Phoenix, AZ 85007 | Phone: 602-256-6945 | Email: info@cassaz.org
eligibility: Adults experiencing homelessness, intake process required
notes: Limited capacity; often at full occupancy, high demand for services

name: Phoenix Rescue Mission
description: Street outreach, emergency shelter, addiction recovery, and support services
contactInfo: 1801 S. 35th Ave., Phoenix, AZ 85009 | Phone: 602-233-3000 | Email: info@phxmission.org
eligibility: Anyone experiencing homelessness or at risk, faith-based organization
notes: Faith-based approach may not appeal to all clients, limited capacity

name: UMOM New Day Centers
description: Emergency shelter, transitional housing, and permanent supportive housing for families, single women, and youth
contactInfo: 3333 E. Van Buren St., Phoenix, AZ 85008 | Phone: 602-275-7852 | Email: information@umom.org
eligibility: Families with children, single women, and youth experiencing homelessness
notes: Waiting lists common, limited capacity for all who need assistance

name: Sojourner Center
description: Emergency shelter, transitional housing, and support services for victims of domestic violence
contactInfo: Phone: 602-244-0089 | 24-Hour Crisis Hotline: 602-889-1610
eligibility: Individuals and families fleeing domestic violence, confidential intake process
notes: Limited capacity, safety concerns require confidential location

name: St. Mary's Food Bank Alliance
description: Food distribution, mobile pantry, and meal programs
contactInfo: 2831 N. 31st Ave., Phoenix, AZ 85009 | Phone: 602-242-3663
eligibility: Anyone in need, no documentation required for emergency food boxes
notes: Limited distribution hours, transportation barriers for some clients

name: U.S.VETS - Phoenix
description: Transitional housing, permanent housing, and supportive services for veterans
contactInfo: 3507 N. Central Ave., Suite 200, Phoenix, AZ 85012 | Phone: 602-305-8585
eligibility: Veterans with proof of service, eligibility varies by program
notes: Limited capacity, documentation requirements can be barriers

name: A New Leaf - East Valley Men's Center
description: Emergency shelter, case management, and support services for men
contactInfo: 2345 N. Country Club Dr., Mesa, AZ 85201 | Phone: 480-610-6722
eligibility: Single men experiencing homelessness, intake process required
notes: Limited capacity (84 beds), often at full occupancy

name: A New Leaf - La Mesita Family Shelter
description: Emergency shelter, transitional housing, and support services for families
contactInfo: 2254 W. Main St., Mesa, AZ 85201 | Phone: 480-969-5233 | Family Housing Hub: 602-595-8700
eligibility: Families with children experiencing homelessness, intake through Family Housing Hub
notes: Waiting lists common, limited capacity for all families in need

name: United Food Bank
description: Food distribution, mobile pantry, and meal programs
contactInfo: 358 E. Javelina Ave., Mesa, AZ 85210 | Phone: 480-926-4897
eligibility: Anyone in need, no documentation required for emergency food
notes: Limited distribution hours, transportation barriers for some clients

name: AZCEND
description: Emergency assistance, food bank, case management, and housing services
contactInfo: 345 S. California St., Chandler, AZ 85225 | Phone: 480-963-1423 | Email: info@azcend.org
eligibility: Low-income individuals and families, eligibility varies by program
notes: Limited direct shelter options, primarily referral-based for housing

name: Chandler CARE Center
description: Food pantry, clothing, and resource referrals
contactInfo: 777 E. Galveston St., Chandler, AZ 85225 | Phone: 480-812-7900
eligibility: Chandler residents, proof of address may be required
notes: Limited hours of operation, primarily serves Chandler residents

name: Gilbert Neighborhood Assistance
description: Resource navigation, emergency assistance, and referrals
eligibility: Gilbert residents, proof of address may be required
notes: No direct shelter services in Gilbert, primarily referral-based

name: Open Arms Care Center
description: Food pantry, clothing assistance, and resource referrals
contactInfo: 925 N. McQueen Rd., Suite 105, Gilbert, AZ | Phone: 480-332-7051
eligibility: Must bring photo ID, proof of Arizona residence, Gilbert CAP card
notes: Limited to one food box per month per household, capacity limitations

name: Scottsdale Homeless Solutions Alliance
description: Street outreach, navigation services, and resource coordination
eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness in Scottsdale
notes: Limited direct shelter options in Scottsdale, primarily referral-based

name: Phoenix Rescue Mission - Scottsdale Day Relief Centers
description: Day relief centers providing meals, rest, clothing, and connection to services
contactInfo: South Scottsdale Presbyterian Church, 3421 N. Hayden Road (Mondays 11am-7pm) and Vista Del Camino Community Center, 7700 E. Roosevelt St. (Tues-Thurs 9am-4pm) | Phone: 602-346-3361
eligibility: Anyone experiencing homelessness, no documentation required
notes: Limited hours of operation, no overnight shelter

name: Tempe Community Action Agency - I-HELP
description: Overnight emergency shelter, meals, shower and laundry services, case management
contactInfo: I-HELP Hotline: 480-389-1277
eligibility: Adults 18+ experiencing homelessness, intake at I-HELP Shelter
notes: Limited capacity (serves up to 40 participants), high demand

name: Tempe Community Action Agency - Food Pantry
description: Food pantry, emergency food boxes, and meal programs
contactInfo: 2146 E. Apache Blvd., Tempe, AZ 85281 | Phone: 480-350-5880
eligibility: Tempe residents, proof of address may be required
notes: Limited hours of operation, primarily serves Tempe residents

name: Glendale Homeless Solutions Alliance
description: 24/7 hotline, street outreach, emergency shelter referrals, case management
contactInfo: Phone: 623-207-8902 | Website: www.cassaz.org
eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness in Glendale
notes: No Wrong Door approach, connects to multiple service providers

name: Glendale Works
description: Day labor employment opportunities for individuals experiencing homelessness
contactInfo: Through Glendale Homeless Solutions Alliance: 623-207-8902
eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness in Glendale
notes: Limited daily positions available, temporary employment only

name: Peoria SUPPORT Services
description: Resource navigation, emergency assistance, and referrals
contactInfo: Through Peoria Resource Center
eligibility: Peoria residents, eligibility varies by program
notes: Limited direct shelter options in Peoria, primarily referral-based

name: A New Leaf - West Valley Housing Assistance Center
description: Emergency housing for families experiencing homelessness, meals, resource center
contactInfo: 12779 W. Grand Ave, Surprise, AZ 85374 | Family Housing Hub: 877-211-8661 | Individual Services: 877-211-8661
eligibility: Families experiencing homelessness, must call Family Housing Hub for placement
notes: Limited capacity (7 apartment-style units), high demand for family shelter

name: Surprise Area Focused on Encampments (SAFE) Reporting App
description: Mobile application for reporting homeless encampments, street outreach services
contactInfo: Surprise Human Service & Community Vitality Department: 623-222-1500
eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness in Surprise
notes: Limited direct shelter options, primarily connects to regional resources

name: SONAR Team (Street Outreach Navigation And Resources)
description: Street outreach, navigation assistance, resource coordination
contactInfo: Phone: 623-333-2713 | Email: SONAR@AvondaleAZ.gov
eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness in Avondale
notes: Limited direct shelter options in Avondale, primarily referral-based

name: Southwest Valley IHELP (Interfaith Homeless Emergency Lodging Program)
description: Emergency overnight shelter through network of faith partners
contactInfo: AZ Complete Health Avondale Resource Center: 623-333-2703
eligibility: Adults experiencing homelessness, intake through Resource Center
notes: Limited capacity, rotating shelter locations

name: Maricopa County Homeless Services
description: Street outreach, navigation services, case management, shelter operations
contactInfo: Human Services Department | Website: https://www.maricopa.gov/1216/Homeless-Services
eligibility: Homeless individuals and families in Maricopa County
notes: Geographic barriers to service access in rural areas, high demand

name: Hand in Hand Street Outreach
description: Outreach services to individuals experiencing homelessness in targeted communities
contactInfo: Website: https://www.maricopa.gov/5808/Hand-in-Hand-Program
eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness in targeted communities
notes: Limited staff capacity, large geographic area to cover

name: Family Housing Hub
description: Centralized intake for families experiencing homelessness, shelter placement
contactInfo: Phone: 602-595-8700 | Website: https://www.fhhub.org/
eligibility: Families with minor children experiencing homelessness
notes: Limited shelter capacity for all families in need, waiting lists common

name: 211 Arizona
description: Statewide information and referral service for housing, food, healthcare, and more
contactInfo: Dial 2-1-1 | Website: https://211arizona.org/
eligibility: Anyone seeking resources, no eligibility requirements
notes: Phone-based service helps overcome geographic barriers, but limited direct services

name: DVSTOP
description: Crisis intervention, safety planning, and shelter referrals
contactInfo: 24-Hour Crisis Hotline: 480-890-3039
eligibility: Individuals experiencing domestic violence
notes: Limited shelter capacity, confidential services

name: Community Bridges, Inc.
description: Substance abuse treatment, detox services, and recovery support
contactInfo: Various locations | Central Phoenix: 602-273-9999 | 24/7 Access to Care: 877-931-9142
eligibility: Individuals seeking substance abuse treatment, eligibility varies by program
notes: Insurance requirements for some programs, limited capacity

name: one-n-ten
description: Support services, housing assistance, and resource referrals for LGBTQ+ youth
contactInfo: Phone: 602-400-2601 | Email: info@onenten.org
eligibility: LGBTQ+ youth ages 11-24
notes: Limited housing options specifically for LGBTQ+ youth

name: International Rescue Committee
description: Resettlement services, housing assistance, employment support
contactInfo: 4425 W. Olive Ave., Suite 400, Glendale, AZ 85302 | Phone: 602-433-2440
eligibility: Refugees, asylees, and other immigrants with legal status
notes: Documentation requirements, limited capacity

name: Tumbleweed Center for Youth Development
description: Emergency shelter, transitional housing, and support services for youth
eligibility: Youth ages 12-25 experiencing homelessness
notes: Limited capacity, high demand for youth services

name: Area Agency on Aging - Region One
description: Housing assistance, case management, and support services for seniors
contactInfo: 1366 E. Thomas Rd., Suite 108, Phoenix, AZ 85014 | Phone: 602-264-4357 | 24-Hour Senior Help Line: 602-264-4357
eligibility: Adults 60+ and individuals with disabilities
notes: Limited funding for direct housing assistance, waiting lists common

name: A New Leaf - Faith House
description: Emergency shelter, transitional housing, and support services for victims of domestic violence
contactInfo: Phone: 480-969-1691 | 24-Hour Crisis Hotline: 480-969-2886
eligibility: Individuals and families fleeing domestic violence, confidential intake process
notes: Limited capacity, safety concerns require confidential location

name: ICAN
description: Youth development programs, family support services, and substance abuse prevention
contactInfo: 650 E. Morelos St., Chandler, AZ 85225 | Phone: 480-821-4207 | Email: info@icanaz.org
eligibility: Youth ages 5-18 and their families, primarily serves Chandler
notes: Limited to youth development, not emergency housing

name: Gilbert Senior Center
description: Meals, activities, and resource referrals for seniors
contactInfo: 130 N. Oak St., Gilbert, AZ 85233 | Phone: 480-503-6061
eligibility: Adults 50+, primarily serves Gilbert residents
notes: No direct housing services, primarily social and nutritional support

name: Vista Del Camino
description: Rent and utility assistance, food bank, employment assistance
contactInfo: 7700 E. Roosevelt St., Scottsdale, AZ 85257 | Phone: 480-312-2323
eligibility: Scottsdale residents, proof of address required
notes: Limited funding, primarily serves Scottsdale residents

name: East Valley Senior Home Sharing Program
description: Matching service for seniors seeking shared housing arrangements
contactInfo: Through Tempe Community Action Agency: 480-350-5880
eligibility: Adults 50+ seeking affordable housing options
notes: Limited availability, compatibility challenges

name: Glendale Community Action Program (CAP)
description: Rent and utility assistance, case management, and resource referrals
contactInfo: Through Glendale Homeless Solutions Alliance: 623-207-8902
eligibility: Glendale residents experiencing financial crisis, income eligibility requirements
notes: Limited funding, high demand for services
